column10: This is one of several near misses that I can remember at this intersection where cars speed to turn right onto NB Glebe and ignore cyclists in the dashed bike lane. Feels very dangerous.

I was riding west on N. Fairfax toward Glebe, was in the floating bike lane. Bus passed very close, while accelerating to make a right turn before the light changed. Not technically in the bike lane, but certainly within 3'

The "right hook" - car turned right from Fairfax heading East to Glebe going South when the light turned green, cutting me off in the crosswalk. It happens often but this was bad, and I'm pretty sure he saw me.
Driver wasn't planning on stopping at stop sign (they did when their bumper nearly hit my shin)
Driver pulled out from a parking spot when an 8 year old cyclist was beside him in the traffic lane, nearly hitting the 8 year old.
